original_title: Only 36-pct of Sri Lanka’s 2024 capital investment utilized in Jan-Aug; port, energy used least
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka has utilized only 36 percent of its 2024 capital investment budget in the first eight months of the year with ports, energy, and health sectors receiving lower allocated funds, a Finance Ministry report showed.

Pre-Election Budgetary Position Report 2024 released by the Finance Ministry this week showed only 389.6 billion rupees out of the budgeted 1,259.8 billion for capital investment has been used in the first eight months.
The previous government increased the allocation for capital investment this year by 35 percent from last year’s 932.7 billion rupees.
The Ports and Shipping sector has used only 3 percent of the budgeted capital investment, 10.8 percent by Power and Energy Sector, and 18.9 percent by health sector, the official data showed.

A government official who is aware of the government spending said delay in infrastructure projects amid dragged bilateral and commercial debt restructuring deals could be a reason for lack of utilization of the allocated budget.
The capital investment spending in the first eight months of 2024 has increased 16.7 percent compared to the 389.6 billion in the same period last year, the data showed.
The road sector has the highest actual expenditure, accounting for around 47 percent of the allocated funds for the sector in 2024.(Colombo/October 19/2024)
